title: Maurice Marinot – On Paper, In Glass
details: An in-focus exhibition showcasing a selection of Maurice Marinot's works spanning the 1900s to the 1950s, including glass objects and drawings, highlighting his pioneering contribution to glassmaking.

title: Créatúir na Cartlainne | Tails from the Archive
details: Celebrates our relationship with animals – as a source of joy, humour, awe, inspiration and companionship. Beloved pets, tiny creatures and wild beasts emerge from the archives of the Centre for the Study of Irish Art; hidden between the pages of sketchbooks and illustrated letters, or captured forever in watercolours and maquettes. The exhibition explores Irish-language words and folk memory related to animals and showcases a menagerie of hidden animals from the Irish art archives.

title: Picasso: From the Studio
details: A major monographic exhibition exploring Pablo Picasso's studios and the influence of his working spaces on his art, featuring paintings, sculptures, ceramics, works on paper, and audiovisual material. Shows Picasso in the context of his studios from early Paris to his Mas Notre-Dame de Vie studio.

title: William Blake: The Age of Romantic Fantasy
From Rembrandt to Matisse – A Celebration of European Prints and Drawings
Hilma af Klint: Artist and Visionary
AIB Young Portrait Prize 2026
details: The annual AIB Young Portrait Prize returns in 2026. Open to young people across the island of Ireland, it encourages creativity and self-expression among young artists aged up to 18. The winners will be announced at a ceremony in November 2026 and the exhibition is in the Portrait Gallery. Admission free.

title: AIB Portrait Prize 2026
details: The annual AIB Portrait Prize returns in 2026, once again celebrating contemporary portraiture by Irish artists from Ireland and abroad. A shortlist of works will be selected by an expert judging panel, with the winning artist receiving a €15,000 prize and a €5,000 commission for inclusion in the National Portrait Collection. The winner will be announced at a ceremony in November 2026. The competition culminates in an exhibition in the Portrait Gallery. Curated by Dr Brendan Rooney. An exhibition sponsored by AIB, organised by the National Gallery of Ireland.
